default: (a)一把{@item 刺劍|phb} 或 (b)一把{@item 短劍|phb}
(a)一把{@item 短弓|phb}和一個裝有{@item 箭(20)|phb|20支箭}的{@item 箭袋|phb} 或 (b)一把{@item 短劍|phb}
(a)一套{@item 竊賊套裝|phb}, (b)一套{@item 地城探險家套裝|phb}, 或 (c)一套{@item 探索者套裝|phb}
一件{@item 皮甲|phb}、二把{@item 匕首|phb}、和一套{@item 盜賊工具|phb}

classFeatures.name: 專精
entries: 在1級時，選擇二個你的技能熟練，或一個你的技能熟練和你對{@item 盜賊工具|phb}的熟練。你的熟練加值在使用所選熟練項所進行的任何屬性檢定中變為兩倍。
在6級時，你可以再選擇另外兩個熟練項（技能或{@item 盜賊工具|phb}）以獲得這個好處。

classFeatures.name: 偷襲
entries: 從1級開始，你知道如何利用敵人的分心以做出巧妙的攻擊。每個回合一次，若你在攻擊檢定中具有優勢，則你可以對一個你用該攻擊命中的生物造成額外的{@dice 1d6}傷害。該攻擊必須要使用一把靈巧或遠程武器。
若有另一個目標的敵人在距離目標5呎內的位置，該敵人未{@condition 無力}，且你在該攻擊檢定中未承受劣勢，則你在該攻擊檢定中不需要具有優勢也可以發動偷襲效果。
這個額外傷害的數值會隨著你提升本職業的等級時增加，參見盜賊表中的偷襲傷害欄位。

classFeatures.name: 竊賊黑話
entries: 在你的盜賊訓練中，你學會了竊賊黑話，一種混雜了方言、黑話、以及暗碼的秘密語言，並讓你得以將訊息隱藏在看似尋常的對話中。只有知曉竊賊黑話的其他生物能夠理解這類訊息。傳達這類訊息需要花上比直白地說出相同意思還要長四倍以上的時間。
此外，你也理解一套用以傳達簡短單純訊息的秘密記號和符號，傳達像是這個區域是否危險或為盜賊公會的領地、附近是否有值錢的東西、或者這個區域的人們是否為老好人或為逃亡中的竊賊提供安全的居所。

classFeatures.name: 巧妙動作
entries: 從2級開始，你的機智和靈巧讓你得以快速地移動和行動。你可以在戰鬥中每個你的回合採取一個附贈動作。這個附贈動作只能被用於採取{@action 疾走}、{@action 撤離}、或{@action 躲藏}動作。

classFeatures.name: 盜賊範型
entries: 在3級時，你從可選範型列表中選擇一種你在行使你盜賊能力時仿效的範型。你所選擇的範型將在3級、9級、13級、和17級時賦予你新的能力。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至4級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 直覺閃避
entries: 從5級開始，當一個你所能看見的攻擊者使用一次攻擊命中你，你可以使用你的反應以減半該次攻擊對你的傷害。

classFeatures.name: 專精
entries: 在6級時，你可以再選擇另外兩個熟練項（技能或{@item 盜賊工具|phb}）以獲得專精的好處。

classFeatures.name: 反射閃避
entries: 從7級開始，你可以靈活地躲開某些範圍效果，像是紅龍的火焰吐息、或{@spell 冰風暴}法術。當你成為一個允許你進行敏捷豁免以僅承受一半傷害的效果的目標時，你改為在豁免成功時不受任何傷害，且在豁免失敗時僅承受一半傷害。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至8級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 盜賊範型能力
entries: 在9級時，你獲得一個由你盜賊範型所賦予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至10級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 可靠才能
entries: 從11級起，你已將你所選的的技能琢磨到臻近完美。每當你進行一個允許你加入你熟練加值的屬性檢定，你可以將其{@dice d20}骰出9或以下的擲骰結果視為10。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至12級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 盜賊範型能力
entries: 在13級時，你獲得一個由你盜賊範型所賦予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 盲感
entries: 從14級開始，若你能夠聽見，則你能夠察覺到任何距離你10呎內躲藏起來或{@condition 隱形}的生物所在的位置。

classFeatures.name: 靈活心智
entries: 從15級起，你養成了強大的心智力量。你獲得對睿知豁免的熟練。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至16級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 盜賊範型能力
entries: 在17級時，你獲得一個由你盜賊範型所賦予的能力。

classFeatures.name: 捉摸不定
entries: 從18級開始，你是如此的難以捕捉以至於攻擊者很少有辦法在對付你時取得優勢。當你不處於{@condition 無力}狀態時，對你進行的所有攻擊檢定都不具有優勢。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至19級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 幸運一擊
entries: 在20級時，你有著在你需要的時候成功的神奇訣竅。若你對一個範圍內目標的攻擊失手，你可以將該次攻擊從失手改成命中。或者，若你在一次屬性檢定中失敗，你可以將其{@dice d20}的擲骰結果視作骰出了20。
一旦你使用此能力，你直到完成一次短休或長休前都不能再使用它。

subclassFeatures.name: 詭術師
entries: 有些盜賊利用魔法增進了他們精心琢磨的隱匿和靈動技巧，學習惑控和幻術系的詭術。這些盜賊包括了扒手和竊賊，但也包括惡作劇者、離間者，和相當數量的冒險者們。

entries.name: 法師之手詐術
entries: 從3級開始，當你施放{@spell 法師之手}時，你可以讓這隻幽靈般的手掌{@condition 隱形}，且你可以用它來進行下列的額外行動：

items: 你可以將一個這隻手所持握的物體放入一個被其他生物所穿戴或攜帶的容器內。
你可以取走一個被裝在其他生物所穿戴或攜帶的容器內的物體。
你可以使用{@item 盜賊工具|phb}以在射程內開鎖或解除陷阱。

entries: 若你成功通過一次對抗某個生物睿知（{@skill 感知}）檢定的敏捷（{@skill 手上把戲}）檢定，則你可以進行上述其中一個行動而不會被該生物察覺。
此外，你可以使用你巧妙動作能力所賦予的附贈動作以控制這隻手。

entries.name: 施法
entries: 當你升至3級時，你獲得了施放法術的能力。請參閱{@book 第十章|PHB|10}以了解關於施法的規則，以及第十一章以查閱{@filter 法師法術列表|spells|class=wizard}。

entries.name: 戲法
entries: 你學會三個戲法：{@spell 法師之手}、和另外二個你從法師法術列表中自選的戲法。你將在10級時學會另一個自選的法師戲法。

entries.name: 法術位
entries: 詭術師施法表中顯示了你有多少個法術位可以用來施放你一環或更高環的{@filter 法師法術|spells|class=wizard}。要施放其中一個法術，你必須消耗一個與該法術環階相同或更高的法術位。你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的法術位。
舉例來說，如果你知曉一個1環法術{@spell 魅惑人類}，且你擁有一個1環和一個2環的法術位，則你可以使用其中任意一個法術位來施放{@spell 魅惑人類}。

entries.name: 一環或更高環的已知法術
entries: 你知曉三個從法師法術列表中自選的1環法術，其中二個必須從法師法術列表中的惑控系和幻術系法術中選擇。
詭術師施法表中的已知法術欄位顯示了你會在何時學習到新的1環或更高環的法師法術。每個這些法術都必須是一個惑控系和幻術系法術，且環階也必須符合你所擁有法術位的環階。舉例來說，當你在此職業升至7級時，你可以學習一個新的1環或2環法術。
你在8級、14級、和20級時所學會的法術可以來自任何魔法學派。
每當你提升這個職業的等級時，你可以從法師法術列表中挑選一個法術來取代一個你目前已知的法師法術。新法術的環階必須符合你所擁有法術位的環階，且它必須是一個惑控系和幻術系法術，除非你取代的法術是你在8級、14級、或20級時所獲得的來自任意魔法學派的法術。

entries.name: 施法屬性
entries: 因為你是透過致力研讀與記憶習得你的法師法術，智力是你施展法師法術的施法屬性。每當法術提及你的施法屬性時，你將使用你的智力。此外，當決定你法師法術的豁免DC、以及使用法師法術進行攻擊檢定時，你使用你的智力調整值。

entries.name: 魔法伏擊
entries: 從9級開始，若你在對一個生物處於躲藏狀態的情況下對它施放一個法術，則該生物在該回合為對抗該法術所進行的任何豁免檢定都將具有劣勢。

entries.name: 萬能詭術
entries: 在13級時，你獲得用你的{@spell 法師之手}以干擾目標的能力。在你的回合以一個附贈動作，你可以指定一個與{@spell 法師之手}法術創造出的幽靈手掌之間距離在5呎內的生物。這麼做會讓你在該回合結束前，對該生物所進行的攻擊檢定中獲得優勢。

entries.name: 法術竊賊
entries: 在17級時，你獲得以魔法從其他施法者手中偷走施展法術知識的能力。

緊接在一個生物施放以你為目標、或將你納入範圍效果的法術之後，你可以使用你的反應以強迫該生物進行一次使用它施法屬性調整值的豁免檢定。這個豁免檢定的DC等同於你的法術豁免DC。若它豁免失敗，你將無效該法術對你的效果，且若該法術為至少1環且為你所能施放的環階（它不需要是法師法術），則你將盜取關於該法術的知識。在接下來的8小時內，你知曉該法術，且可以使用你的法術位施放它。該生物直到8小時經過之前都無法再施放該法術。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次長休之前你都不能再使用它。

subclassFeatures.name: 刺客
entries: 你專注你的訓練於殘忍冷酷的死亡藝術。那些遵從這個範型的人們有各式各樣：雇傭殺手、間諜、賞金獵人、和甚至那些受訓於為他們神祇殲滅敵人的特殊祭司。隱匿、用毒、和易容都能協助你在排除敵人時發揮致命的奇效。
你的範型將在3級、9級、13級、和17級時賦予你新的能力。

entries.name: 刺殺
entries: 從3級開始，你在先發制人的時刻是最致命的。你對任何在戰鬥中尚未行動過的生物所進行的攻擊檢定具有優勢。此外，任何你命中被突襲生物的攻擊都是重擊。

entries.name: 額外熟練
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你獲得{@item 易容工具組|phb}和{@item 製毒工具組|phb}的熟練。

entries.name: 專業滲透
entries: 從9級開始，你可以為自己創造出可靠的假身分。你必須花費七天的時間和25金幣以為該身分編造歷史紀錄、職業、以及人際關係。你無法編造一個屬於他人的身分。舉例來說，你可能會需要取得相應的服裝、介紹信、以及看似官方的證明文件，來為自己建立一個來自偏遠城市商行成員的身分，並使你得以混入其他富商團體中。
在這之後，若你採用該身分做為偽裝，其他生物將會相信你就是那個人，直到另有明顯證據證明你不是。

entries.name: 冒充者
entries: 在13級時，你獲得準確模仿其他人說話、書寫、和行為舉止的能力。你必須花費至少三個小時的時間以研究該人物行為中的這三個要素：聆聽他的說話腔調、檢視字跡、以及觀察舉止習慣。
你的詭計對尋常觀察者而言難以分辨。若一個謹慎的生物因一些模仿缺陷而開始懷疑，則你在任何你用以避免被察覺所進行魅力（{@skill 欺瞞}）檢定中具有優勢。

entries.name: 死亡一擊
entries: 從17級開始，你成為了讓人在瞬間死亡的宗師。當你攻擊並命中一個被突襲的生物，它必須進行一次體質豁免（DC為8+你的敏捷調整值+你的熟練加值）。若豁免失敗，則你對該生物造成的傷害將變為二倍。

subclassFeatures.name: 竊賊
entries: 你磨練你在盜竊技藝上的技巧。小偷、強盜、扒手、和其他罪犯通常會遵從這個範型，而那些自詡為專業尋寶家、探險家、探索者、和調查員的盜賊也是如此。除了提升你的靈巧和隱匿技術之外，你也學習在探索古代廢墟、解讀罕見語言、和使用那些你通常無法使用的魔法物品時能派上用場的技術。

entries.name: 快手
entries: 從3級開始，你可以使用你巧妙動作能力所賦予的附贈動作來進行一次敏捷（{@skill 手上把戲}）檢定、使用你的{@item 盜賊工具|phb}以解除陷阱或開鎖、或採取{@action 使用物件}動作。

entries.name: 梁上君子
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你獲得能攀爬的比原本更快的能力；攀爬不再需要花費你額外的移動速度。
此外，當你進行助跑跳遠時，你可以跨越的距離將增加等同於你敏捷調整值的呎數。

entries.name: 卓越潛行
entries: 從9級開始，若你移動不超過你移動速度一半的距離，你在同個回合所進行的敏捷（{@skill 隱匿}）檢定中具有優勢。

entries.name: 使用魔法裝置
entries: 從13級起，你學會了足夠多關於魔法如何運作的知識，並讓你可以即興使用那些不是設計給你使用的物品。你在使用魔法物品時忽略它所有的職業、種族、和等級需求。

entries.name: 竊賊反射
entries: 當你升至17級時，你已成為了伏擊與快速逃離危險的行家。你在任何戰鬥的第一輪中可以進行二個回合。你在你正常的先攻值進行你的第一個回合，並在你先攻值減10的順序進行你的第二個回合。你不能在你被突襲的時候使用這個能力。

subclassFeatures.name: Mastermind
entries: Your focus is on people and on the influence and secrets they have. Many spies, courtiers, and schemers follow this archetype, leading lives of intrigue. Words are your weapons as often as knives or poison, and secrets and favors are some of your favorite treasures.

entries.name: Master of Intrigue
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with the {@item disguise Kit|phb}, the {@item forgery kit|phb}, and one gaming set of your choice. You also learn two languages of your choice.

Additionally, you can unerringly mimic the speech patterns and accent of a creature that you hear speak for at least 1 minute, allowing you to pass yourself off as a native speaker of a particular land, provided that you know the language.

entries.name: Master of Tactics
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use the {@action Help} action as a bonus action. Additionally, when you use the {@action Help} action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than 5 feet of you, if the target can see or hear you.

entries.name: Insightful Manipulator
entries: Starting at 9th level, if you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:
At the DM's option, you might also realize you know a piece of the creature's history or one of its personality traits, if it has any.

entries.name: Misdirection
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you can sometimes cause another creature to suffer an attack meant for you. When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover against that attack, you can use your reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

entries.name: Soul of Deceit
entries: Starting at 17th level, your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means, unless you allow it. You can present false thoughts by making a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the mind reader's Wisdom (Insight) check.

Additionally, no matter what you say, magic that would determine if you are telling the truth indicates you are being truthful, if you so choose, and you can't be compelled to tell the truth by magic.

subclassFeatures.name: Inquisitive
entries: As an archetypal Inquisitive, you excel at rooting out secrets and unraveling mysteries. You rely on your sharp eye for details, but also on your finely honed ability to read the words and deeds of other creatures to determine their true intent. You excel at defeating creatures that hide among and prey upon ordinary folk, and your mastery of lore and your sharp eye make you well equipped to expose and end hidden evils.

entries.name: Ear for Deceit
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you develop a keen ear for picking out lies. Whenever you make a Wisdom (Insight) check to sense if a creature is lying, you use the total of your check or 8 + your Wisdom modifier, whichever is higher. If you are proficient in Insight, you add your proficiency bonus to the fixed result. If you chose Insight as a skill augmented by your Expertise feature, add double your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Eye for Detail
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use the bonus action granted by your Cunning Action feature to make a Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a hidden creature or object, to make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to uncover and decipher clues, or to use Insightful Fighting.

entries.name: Insightful Fighting
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to decipher an opponent's tactics and develop a counter to them. As an action (or as a bonus action using Eye for Detail), you make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a creature you can see that isn't {@condition incapacitated}, opposed by the target's Charisma (Deception) check. If you succeed, you can use Sneak Attack against that creature even if you do not have advantage against it or if no enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it. You can use Sneak Attack in this way even if you have disadvantage against the target.
This benefit lasts for 1 minute or until you successfully use Insightful Fighting against a different target.

entries.name: Steady Eye
entries: At 9th level, you gain advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) check made on your turn to find a hidden creature or object if you do not move during that turn. If you use this ability before moving, you cannot move or ready movement during your turn.

entries.name: Unerring Eye
entries: At 13th level, you gain the ability to detect magical deception. As an action, you sense the presence within 30 feet of you of illusions, shapechanger creatures not in their true form, and other magic designed to deceive the senses. Though you determine that an effect is attempting to trick you, you gain no special insight into what is hidden or its true nature.

entries.name: Eye for Weakness
entries: At 17th level, you learn to exploit a creature's weaknesses by carefully studying its tactics and movement. While your Insightful Fighting feature applies to a creature, your Sneak Attack damage against that creature increases by {@dice 2d6}.

subclassFeatures.name: Swashbuckler
entries: You focus your training on the art of the blade, relying on speed, elegance, and charisma in equal parts. While other warriors are brutes clad in heavy armor, your method of fighting looks more like performance. Rakes, duelists, and pirates typically follow this archetype.

A swashbuckler excels in single combat, and can fight with two weapons while safely darting away from an opponent. Swashbucklers are especially talented at making difficult maneuvers to escape enemies or attack from an unexpected direction.

entries.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal. During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature cannot make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

entries.name: Rakish Audacity
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your unmistakable confidence propels you into battle. You add your Charisma modifier to your initiative rolls.

In addition, you don't need advantage on your attack roll to use your Sneak Attack if no creature other than your target is within 5 feet of you. All the other rules for the Sneak Attack class feature still apply to you.

entries.name: Panache
entries: At 9th level, your charm becomes extraordinarily beguiling. As an action, you can make a Charisma (Persuasion) check contested by a creature's Wisdom (Insight) check. The creature must be able to hear you, and the two of you must share a language.

If you succeed on the check and the creature is hostile to you, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you and can't make opportunity attacks against targets other than you. This effect lasts for 1 minute, until one of your companions attacks the target or affects it with a spell, or until you and the target are more than 60 feet apart.

If you succeed on the check and the creature isn't hostile to you, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, it regards you as a friendly acquaintance. This effect ends immediately if you or your companions do anything harmful to it.

entries.name: Elegant Maneuver
entries: Starting at 13th level, you can use a bonus action on your turn to gain advantage on the next Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) or Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check you make during the same turn.

entries.name: Master Duelist
entries: Beginning at 17th level, your mastery of the blade lets you turn failure to success in combat. If you miss with an attack roll, you can choose to roll it again with advantage. Once you do so, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Scout
entries: You are skilled in woodcraft and stealth, allowing you to range ahead of your companions during expeditions. Rogues who embrace this archetype are at home in the wilderness and among barbarians and fighters, as they serve as the eyes and ears of war bands across the world. Compared to other rogues, you are skilled at surviving in the wilds.

entries.name: Survivalist
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

entries.name: Skirmisher
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you are difficult to pin down during a fight. You can move up to half your speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Superior Mobility
entries: At 9th level, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

entries.name: Ambush Master
entries: Starting at 13th level, you excel at leading ambushes. If any of your foes are surprised, you can use a bonus action on your turn in the first round of the combat to grant each ally who can see you a +5 bonus to initiative that lasts until the combat ends. If the initiative bonus would increase an ally's initiative above yours, the ally's initiative instead equals your initiative.
Each of the allies also receives a 10-foot increase to speed that lasts until the end of the ally's next turn.

entries.name: Sudden Strike
entries: Starting at 17th level, you can strike with deadly speed. If you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a bonus action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but only if the attack is the only one you make against the target this turn.

subclassFeatures.name: 審訊者
entries: 做為一名典型的審訊者，你擅長於揭開秘密並釐清謎團。你不只靠你那銳利的雙眼去尋找細節，也運用你那磨練過的高超技藝去閱讀其他生物的言行，以發現他們真實的意圖。你擅長於擊敗那些藏身於平民之間並以平民為食的怪物，且你對於學識的掌握和敏銳的演繹能力也讓你能更好地揭露並終結潛藏的邪惡。

entries.name: 辨謊之耳
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你發展出了分辨謊言的天賦。每當你進行一次睿知（{@skill 察言觀色}）檢定以辨別一個生物是否說謊時，你將{@dice d20}骰出的7或更低的擲骰結果視作骰出8。

entries.name: 明察之眼
entries: 從3級開始，你可以使用一個附贈動作以進行一次睿知（{@skill 感知}）檢定以發現隱藏的生物或物體，或進行一次智力（{@skill 調查}）檢定以揭示或破譯線索。

entries.name: 戰鬥洞察
entries: 在3級時，你獲得破譯對手的戰術並加以反制的能力。以一個附贈動作，你可以進行一次睿知（{@skill 察言觀色}）檢定，對抗一個你所能看見且未處於{@condition 無力}狀態的生物的魅力（{@skill 欺瞞}）檢定。若你成功，則即使你對它的攻擊檢定不具有優勢，你仍然可以對它使用你的偷襲能力。但若你在該攻擊檢定上具有劣勢則不行。
這個好處將持續1分鐘，或直到你對另一個不同的目標成功使用此能力。

entries.name: 穩定之眼
entries: 從9級開始，若你移動不超過你移動速度一半的距離，你在同個回合所進行的任何睿知（{@skill 感知}）或智力（{@skill 調查}）檢定中具有優勢。

entries.name: 精準之眼
entries: 從13級開始，你的感知能力幾乎不可能被挫敗。以一個動作，只要你不處於{@condition 目盲}或{@condition 耳聾}狀態，你就可以感知到距離你30呎內的幻象的存在、不處於它原本型態的變形者、以及其他用以欺瞞感官的魔法。你能感知到正嘗試欺騙你的效果，但你無法得知它所隱藏的事物或它真正的性質。
你可以使用這個能力的次數等同於你的睿知調整值（最少一次），且你在完成一次長休後恢復所有你花費掉的次數。

entries.name: 識破弱點
entries: 在17級時，你學會藉由謹慎研究一個生物的戰術和行動以利用它的弱點。當你的戰鬥洞察能力適用於一個生物時，你對該生物的偷襲傷害增加{@dice 3d6}點。

subclassFeatures.name: 策士
entries: 策士專注於人們、對人們的影響力、以及他們所擁有的秘密。許多間諜、朝臣、和陰謀家會遵從這個範型，過著勾心鬥角的生活。你使用言語做為你的武器，就如同使用刀刃和毒藥一樣頻繁，而人們的祕密和支持則是你最喜愛的寶藏之一。

entries.name: 陰謀大師
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，你獲得{@item 易容工具組|phb}、{@item 偽造工具組|phb}、和一種你所選擇的遊戲套組的熟練。你也學會二種你所選擇的語言。
此外，只要你知曉該語言，你就可以準確地模仿一個你曾聽過它說話至少1分鐘的生物的語氣和腔調，這讓你得以把你自己偽裝成某個特定國家的母語使用者。

entries.name: 戰術大師
entries: 從3級開始，你能夠以一個附贈動作採取{@action 協助}動作。此外，當你使用{@action 協助}動作以援助盟友攻擊一個生物時，若目標可以看見或聽見你，則該攻擊的目標可以在距離你30呎內的位置，而非原本的5呎內。

entries.name: 洞察能手
entries: 從9級開始，若你花費至少1分鐘的時間在戰鬥外觀察另一個生物或與之互動，則你可以得知某些關於它能力的情報。DM將會告訴你在下列兩個你所選擇的項目中，該生物的能力是與你相同、強於你、或是弱於你：
根據DM的選擇，你也可能會發現自己知曉該生物的一段經歷，或它其中一個人格特質，若它有的話。

entries.name: 誤導攻擊
entries: 從13級開始，你有時可以讓另一個生物代為承受針對你的攻擊。當你被一次攻擊指定為目標，且有一個距離你5呎內的生物為你對該攻擊提供了掩護，則你可以使用你的反應以讓該攻擊改為指定該生物做為目標。

entries.name: 欺瞞之魂
entries: 從17級開始，除非你允許，否則你的思想無法被心靈感應或其他手段給閱讀。你可以藉由成功通過一次對抗讀心者睿知（{@skill 察言觀色}）檢定的魅力（{@skill 欺瞞}）檢定，以編造假冒的思想使對方信以為真。
此外，無論你說什麼，你總是可以讓判斷你是否誠實的魔法認為你說出了實話，且你不會被魔法強迫說出實話。

subclassFeatures.name: 斥侯
entries: You are skilled in stealth and surviving far from the streets of a city, allowing you to scout ahead of your companions during expeditions. Rogues who embrace this archetype are at home in the wilderness and among barbarians and rangers, and many Scouts serve as the eyes and ears of war bands. Ambusher, spy, bounty hunter—these are just a few of the roles that Scouts assume as they range the world.

entries.name: 散兵戰術
entries: 從3級開始，you are difficult to pin down during a fight. You can move up to half your speed as a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: 求生專家
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，you gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

entries.name: 優越機動
entries: At 9th level, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

entries.name: 伏擊大師
entries: 從13級開始，you excel at leading ambushes and acting first in a fight.

You have advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the first creature you hit during the first round of a combat becomes easier for you and others to strike; attack rolls against that target have advantage until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: 突發猛擊
entries: 從17級開始，you can strike with deadly speed. If you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a bonus action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but you can't use your Sneak Attack against the same target more than once in a turn.

subclassFeatures.name: 風流劍客
entries: You focus your training on the art of the blade, relying on speed, elegance, and charm in equal parts. While some warriors are brutes clad in heavy armor, your method of fighting looks almost like a performance. Duelists and pirates typically belong to this archetype.
A Swashbuckler excels in single combat, and can fight with two weapons while safely darting away from an opponent.

entries.name: 華麗步法
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此範型時，you learn how to land a strike and then slip away without reprisal. During your turn, if you make a melee attack against a creature, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

entries.name: 放蕩無畏
entries: 從3級開始，your confidence propels you into battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier.

You also gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; you don't need advantage on the attack roll to use your Sneak Attack against a creature if you are within 5 feet of it, no other creatures are within 5 feet of you, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll. All the other rules for Sneak Attack still apply to you.

entries.name: 瀟灑氣質
entries: At 9th level, your charm becomes extraordinarily beguiling. As an action, you can make a Charisma (Persuasion) check contested by a creature's Wisdom (Insight) check. The creature must be able to hear you, and the two of you must share a language.

If you succeed on the check and the creature is hostile to you, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you and can't make opportunity attacks against targets other than you. This effect lasts for 1 minute, until one of your companions attacks the target or affects it with a spell, or until you and the target are more than 60 feet apart.

If you succeed on the check and the creature isn't hostile to you, it is {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed}, it regards you as a friendly acquaintance. This effect ends immediately if you or your companions do anything harmful to it.

entries.name: 優雅戰技
entries: 從13級開始，你可以在你的回合使用一個附贈動作，以使你在同個回合內所進行的下一個敏捷（{@skill 特技}）或力量（{@skill 運動}）檢定中具有優勢。

entries.name: 決鬥大師
entries: 從17級開始，your mastery of the blade lets you turn failure into success in combat. If you miss with an attack roll, you can roll it again with advantage. Once you do so, you can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Acrobat
entries: {@i Transcribed on 2018-04-07. [Square bracketed text] denotes transcriber's annotations.}
Your archetype grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

entries.name: Aerial Artistry
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability {@i [to]} move with incredible speed, precision, and power, Few obstacles can prevent you from reaching your destination.

When you move, you can instead take two short movements by flying. Each movement is half your speed, and you must end each one on a solid object or {@i [the]} ground. If you do not, you fall and your movement ends.

entries.name: Fearless Aerialist
entries: Starting at 9th level, you no longer take damage from falling.

entries.name: Unchained Agility
entries: At 13th level, your agility, speed and flexibility allow you to escape from almost any danger. You gain the benefits of {@spell freedom of movement}.

entries.name: Aerial Mastery
entries: At 17th level your Aerial Artistry ability improves. When you move you can instead take four short movements by flying. {@i [Each short movement is still limited to half your speed, and between each movement you must still touch a solid object or the ground. If you do not, you fall and your movement ends.]}

Signaling for her companions to wait, a halfling creeps forward through the dungeon hall. She presses an ear to the door, then pulls out a set of tools and picks the lock in the blink of an eye. Then she disappears into the shadows as her fighter friend moves forward to kick the door open.

A human lurks in the shadows of an alley while his accomplice prepares for her part in the ambush. When their target—a notorious slaver—passes the alleyway, the accomplice cries out, the slaver comes to investigate, and the assassin's blade cuts his throat before he can make a sound.

Suppressing a giggle, a gnome waggles her fingers and magically lifts the key ring from the guard's belt. In a moment, the keys are in her hand, the cell door is open, and she and her companions are free to make their escape.

Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes' vulnerabilities to get the upper hand in any situation. They have a knack for finding the solution to just about any problem, demonstrating a resourcefulness and versatility that is the cornerstone of any successful adventuring party.

entries.name: Skill and Precision
entries: Rogues devote as much effort to mastering the use of a variety of skills as they do to perfecting their combat abilities, giving them a broad expertise that few other characters can match. Many rogues focus on stealth and deception, while others refine the skills that help them in a dungeon environment, such as climbing, finding and disarming traps, and opening locks.

When it comes to combat, rogues prioritize cunning over brute strength. A rogue would rather make one precise strike, placing it exactly where the attack will hurt the target most, than wear an opponent down with a barrage of attacks. Rogues have an almost supernatural knack for avoiding danger, and a few learn magical tricks to supplement their other abilities.

entries.name: A Shady Living
entries: Every town and city has its share of rogues. Most of them live up to the worst stereotypes of the class, making a living as burglars, assassins, cutpurses, and con artists. Often, these scoundrels are organized into thieves' guilds or crime families. Plenty of rogues operate independently, but even they sometimes recruit apprentices to help them in their scams and heists. A few rogues make an honest living as locksmiths, investigators, or exterminators, which can be a dangerous job in a world where dire rats—and wererats—haunt the sewers.

As adventurers, rogues fall on both sides of the law. Some are hardened criminals who decide to seek their fortune in treasure hoards, while others take up a life of adventure to escape from the law. Some have learned and perfected their skills with the explicit purpose of infiltrating ancient ruins and hidden crypts in search of treasure.

entries.name: Creating a Rogue
entries: As you create your rogue character, consider the character's relationship to the law. Do you have a criminal past—or present? Are you on the run from the law or from an angry thieves' guild master? Or did you leave your guild in search of bigger risks and bigger rewards? Is it greed that drives you in your adventures, or some other desire or ideal?

What was the trigger that led you away from your previous life? Did a great con or heist gone terribly wrong cause you to reevaluate your career? Maybe you were lucky and a successful robbery gave you the coin you needed to escape the squalor of your life. Did wanderlust finally call you away from your home? Perhaps you suddenly found yourself cut off from your family or your mentor, and you had to find a new means of support. Or maybe you made a new friend—another member of your adventuring party—who showed you new possibilities for earning a living and employing your particular talents.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a rogue quickly by following these suggestions. First, Dexterity should be your highest ability score. Make Intelligence your next-highest if you want to excel at Investigation or plan to take up the Arcane Trickster archetype. Choose Charisma instead if you plan to emphasize deception and social interaction. Second, choose the {@background charlatan} background.
People forget that the entire point of venturing down into a dusty tomb is to bring back the prizes hidden away there. Fighting is for fools. Dead men can't spend their fortunes.

When brute force won't get the job done, or when magic isn't available or appropriate, the rogue rises to the fore. With skills tied to stealth, subterfuge, and trickery, rogues can get into and out of trouble in ways that few other characters can emulate.

Some rogues who turn to adventuring are former criminals who have decided that dodging monsters is preferable to remaining one step ahead of the law. Others are professional killers in search of a profitable application of their talents between contracts. Some simply love the thrill of overcoming any challenge that stands in their way.

On adventures, a rogue is likely to mix an outwardly cautious approach—few rogues enjoy combat—with a ravenous hunger for loot. Most of the time, in a rogue's mind, taking up arms against a creature is not about killing the creature but about becoming the new owner of its treasure.
The following sections explore certain facets of what it means to be a rogue, which you can use to add depth to your character.

entries.name: Guilty Pleasures
entries: Most of what rogues do revolves around obtaining treasure and preventing others from doing the same. Little gets in the way of attaining those goals, except that many rogues are enticed away from that path by a compulsion that clouds their thinking—an irresistible need that must be satisfied, even if doing so is risky.

A rogue's guilty pleasure could be the acquisition of a physical item, something to be experienced, or a way of conducting oneself at certain times. One rogue might not be able to pass up any loot made of silver, for instance, even if said loot is hanging around the neck of a castle guard. Another one can't go through a day in the city without lifting a purse or two, just to keep in practice.
What's the one form of temptation that your rogue character can't resist when the opportunity presents itself, even if giving into it might mean trouble for you and your companions?

entries.caption: Guilty Pleasures
rows: A smile from a pretty face
A new ring for your finger
The chance to deflate someone's ego
Adding to your collection of exotic coins

entries.name: Adversaries
entries: Naturally, those who enforce the law are bound to come up against those who break it, and it's the rare rogue who isn't featured on at least one wanted poster. Beyond that, it's in the nature of their profession that rogues often come into contact with criminal elements, whether out of choice or necessity. Some of those people can be adversaries too, and they're likely to be harder to deal with than the average member of the city watch.

If your character's backstory doesn't already include a personage of this sort, you could work with your DM to come up with a reason why an adversary has appeared in your life. Perhaps you've been the subject of scrutiny for a while from someone who wants to use you for nefarious purposes and has just now become known to you. Such an incident could be the basis for an upcoming adventure.
Does your rogue character have an adversary who also happens to be a criminal? If so, how is this relationship affecting your life?

entries.caption: Adversaries
rows: The pirate captain on whose ship you once served; what you call moving on, the captain calls mutiny
A master spy to whom you unwittingly fed bad information, which led to the assassination of the wrong target
The master of the local thieves' guild, who wants you to join the organization or leave town
An art collector who uses illegal means to acquire masterpieces
A fence who uses you as a messenger to set up illicit meetings
The proprietor of an illegal pit fighting arena where you once took bets

entries.name: Benefactor
entries: Few rogues make it far in life before needing someone's help, which means thereafter owing that benefactor a significant debt.

If your character's backstory doesn't already include a personage of this sort, you could work with your DM to determine why a benefactor has appeared in your life. Perhaps you benefited from something your benefactor did for you without realizing who was responsible, and that person has now just become known to you. Who helped you in the past, whether or not you knew it at the time, and what do you owe that person as recompense?

entries.caption: Benefactors
rows: A smuggler kept you from getting caught but lost a valuable shipment in doing so. Now you owe that person an equally valuable favor.
The Beggar King has hidden you from your pursuers many times, in return for future considerations.
A magistrate once kept you out of jail in return for information on a powerful crime lord.
Your parents used their savings to bail you out of trouble in your younger days and are now destitute.
A dragon didn't eat you when it had a chance, and in return you promised to set aside choice pieces of treasure for it.
A druid once helped you out of a tight spot; now any random animal you see could be that benefactor, perhaps come to claim a return favor.
